overview_summary: None of the identified neighboring individual landowners have a documented stance on local development, as no public comments or records were found. All four residents appear to have low community influence, with no formal civic roles or notable public presence among them. One adjacent industrial landowner is a major company (handled separately), suggesting the only high-influence neighbor lies outside the individual resident profiles.

neighbors.name: Charles Rolfe
neighbors.claims: Charles Rolfe is listed as the owner of a residential parcel (SBL 159.50-2-53) in Niagara Falls【Niagara County PROS — gov, retrieved 2025-11-07; "provides the capability to search property information for any parcel in Niagara County"】. No public comments by Rolfe on development were found in city records or local news【Niagara Falls Clerk archives — gov, retrieved 2025-11-07; "No `find` results for pattern: `rolfe`"】.

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a local community liaison reach out respectfully to share project information, as he has no known stance.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage her through a friendly, personal outreach (e.g., door-to-door visit) focusing on listening to any concerns she may have.

neighbors.name: Teresa Macri
neighbors.claims: Teresa Macri’s property at 461 22nd Street was sold in October 2025 for approximately $55,000【Trulia — other, retrieved 2025-11-07; "SOLD OCT 9, 2025\u00a0\u2013\u00a0$55,000"】. Aside from that real estate transaction, Macri has no documented public involvement or statements regarding local development【Niagara Falls Clerk archives — gov, retrieved 2025-11-07; "No `find` results for pattern: `macri`"】.

approach_recommendations.engage: If she remains in the community, approach via a courteous personal contact (possibly through a mutual local acquaintance), since she has no stated stance or public role.

neighbors.name: Washington Mills Electro
neighbors.claims: Washington Mills Electro is a manufacturing company (specializing in abrasive and fused mineral products) operating a large industrial plant at 1801 Buffalo Avenue in Niagara Falls【MapQuest — other, retrieved 2025-11-07; "Washington Mills, 1801 Buffalo Ave, Niagara Falls, NY 14303"】.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engagement should occur through official channels with corporate leadership, emphasizing transparency, local economic benefits, and addressing any operational concerns.
